body_html:
$ cat /etc/lsb-release DISTRIB_CODENAME=trusty DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 14.04 LTS" $ pip --version pip 1.5.4 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7) $ pip install backports.weakref Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement backports.weakref (from versions: 1.0rc1, 1.0rc1) $ pip install backports.weakref>=1.0rc1 (does NOTHING - just exits) $ pip install backports.weakref==1.0rc1 (works!) so, please keep the string "backports.weakref==1.0rc1", not "backports.weakref>=1.0rc1" and do not remove the version number.
…
On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 2:06 AM, Michaël Defferrard ***@***.*** > wrote: I just checked on Ubuntu 16.04 with Python 2.7 and it worked fine without giving any version number either: $ pip --version pip 8.1.1 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7) $ pip install --user backports.weakref Collecting backports.weakref Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl Installing collected packages: backports.weakref Successfully installed backports.weakref Shall we get rid of the version number altogether? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#11174 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim_nq_MRZO4_Zz6N70KhN0tech_f4ks5sKgB9gaJpZM4OKnup> .
body_text:
$ cat /etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_CODENAME=trusty
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 14.04 LTS"

$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ pip install backports.weakref
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement backports.weakref
(from versions: 1.0rc1, 1.0rc1)

$ pip install backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
(does NOTHING - just exits)

$ pip install backports.weakref==1.0rc1
(works!)

so, please keep the string "backports.weakref==1.0rc1", not
"backports.weakref>=1.0rc1" and do not remove the version number.
…
On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 2:06 AM, Michaël Defferrard ***@***.*** > wrote:
 I just checked on Ubuntu 16.04 with Python 2.7 and it worked fine without
 giving any version number either:

 $ pip --version
 pip 8.1.1 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

 $ pip install --user backports.weakref
 Collecting backports.weakref
   Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
 Installing collected packages: backports.weakref
 Successfully installed backports.weakref

 Shall we get rid of the version number altogether?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#11174 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim_nq_MRZO4_Zz6N70KhN0tech_f4ks5sKgB9gaJpZM4OKnup>
 .
body:
$ cat /etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_CODENAME=trusty
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 14.04 LTS"

$ pip --version
pip 1.5.4 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)

$ pip install backports.weakref
Downloading/unpacking backports.weakref
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement backports.weakref
(from versions: 1.0rc1, 1.0rc1)

$ pip install backports.weakref>=1.0rc1
(does NOTHING - just exits)

$ pip install backports.weakref==1.0rc1
(works!)

so, please keep the string "backports.weakref==1.0rc1", not
"backports.weakref>=1.0rc1" and do not remove the version number.

On Tue, Jul 4, 2017 at 2:06 AM, Michaël Defferrard <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> I just checked on Ubuntu 16.04 with Python 2.7 and it worked fine without
> giving any version number either:
>
> $ pip --version
> pip 8.1.1 from /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (python 2.7)
>
> $ pip install --user backports.weakref
> Collecting backports.weakref
>   Downloading backports.weakref-1.0rc1-py2-none-any.whl
> Installing collected packages: backports.weakref
> Successfully installed backports.weakref
>
> Shall we get rid of the version number altogether?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
